intro: Capsella furcata, commonly known as the forked knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Capsella furcata is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 30 centimeters tall, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
